issuetype.description: An improvement or enhancement to an existing feature or task.
issuetype.name: Improvement

fields.description:
Add gmock to the toolchain.

 

It looks like before this can happen, a gmock feedstock on conda-forge has to be setup so our CI setup can work.

comments.body: [~emkornfield@gmail.com] Do you take care of the conda-forge package or would you appreciate it if I do this?
[~xhochy] I was planning on trying to take care of this (my first time working with conda-forge so it might take me a little while) but if I run into any blockers I might ask for help.
I opened [https://github.com/conda-forge/gtest-feedstock/issues/31] to see if I can add gmock to existing gtest or if I will need to create a new feedstock.
The C++ ABI migration causes errors when trying to link libgmock_main against the rest of the build.  I think once we are migrated to the updated conda-forge packaging system things should work.

current issue seems to be linking on trusty:

https://travis-ci.org/apache/arrow/builds/486300854?utm_source=github_status&utm_medium=notification
